task_summary: The robot must reach a towel placed on a workspace by perceiving, navigating to, and aligning its end-effector above or on the towel, without grasping or manipulating it.

task_long_description.overview: This sequence involves a bimanual xArm robot operating in a workspace with a pink towel on a green mat. The robot's main purpose is to approach and align with the towel, starting from a ready pose. No grasp or manipulation occurs. The robot must first detect (or verify visibility of) the towel, then move above it, and finally approach closely, aligning to complete 'reaching'. The sequence avoids any interaction or placement.
preconditions: Towel is present and visible on the workspace
stepwise_plan: Check if the towel is visible; if not, scan workspace to locate the towel
Detect and localize the towel more precisely
Move above the towel (offset in z for clearance)
Approach and align toward the towel with a small tolerance
Verify if end-effector is at the target (towel) location
success_criteria: Robot end-effector is aligned above or touching the towel as per final frame
No collision with other objects or workspace
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect towel: Scan grid up to 3 times
Cannot approach target: Abort with failure
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when robot confirms 'IsAt' the towel target or on irrecoverable perception/action failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the towel is currently visible to perception systems
Scans the workspace using a grid pattern to find the towel
Runs object detection for the towel
Moves end-effector above the towel with 5cm offset
Approaches and aligns robot to the towel with small tolerance
Checks if end-effector is at the towel target pose

failure_modes: Move/approach to towel blocked or collision detected
recovery_strategy: Scan up to three times if towel not initially visible
assumptions: Frames provide enough evidence: robot stops above (not grasping or manipulating) the towel; no reach-and-grasp, only reaching.
No force/precision/timing constraints inferred or required.
Task instruction is simpler than typical manipulation; no object transfer or place.
Towel is always the target, no confusion with workspace features.

expected_success_criteria: End-effector is above or near towel (as in final frames)
No collision with workspace or towel
